spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Slumber's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Confusing Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the umber hulk and is able to see the umber hulk's eyes, the umber hulk can magically force it to make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, unless the umber hulk is {@condition incapacitated}.

On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the umber hulk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the umber hulk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The umber hulk can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5 foot-wide, 8-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Slumber has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Slumber's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: Slumber senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The umber hulk makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its mandibles. Alternatively, the umber hulk can replace one of its claw attacks to cast a spell.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

Slumber is an Umber Hulk that has grown adept with various enchantment magics, even going as far as casting some of these spells at will. Slumber doesn't particularly hunt every living creature for food, in fact he prefers to eat other monstrosities that lives down in the Underdark, as opposed to their typical diets of humanoids. He goes scavenging for various minerals and precious gems.

entries.name: Devious Delvers
entries: Umber hulks can burrow through solid rock, forming new tunnels in their wake. The steel-hard chitin of its body can withstand the cave-ins, tunnel collapses, and rock falls that commonly follow it.

Burrowing into the wall of a cavern or passageway, an umber hulk lies in wait for creatures to pass by on the other side, its hair-like feelers sensing any movement around it. When it explodes out in a shower of earth and rock, its unsuspecting quarry turns to face the oncoming threat-and is entranced by the umber hulk's bewildering eyes, forced to stand helpless as its mandibles snap shut.

entries.name: Mind Scrambler
entries: Many survivors of an umber hulk encounter recollect little about the attack, because the monster's confusing gaze scrambles their memory of the event. Those who have fought and killed umber hulks recognize the signs. For other denizens of the Underdark, grisly tales of vanished explorers and wanton destruction speak of an unknown foe. Umber hulks take on supernatural status in these harrowing stories, many of which convey the same warning: once an umber hulk has been spotted, it is already too late to escape it.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When Warren Malqir reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, Warren Malqir can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Warren Malqir can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Warren Malqir is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Warren Malqir instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Great Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

Warren has trained his entire life to guard his home, Port Cattamoly. One day, he failed his people and the port was destroyed. He returned to his training after being rescued and trained in a dimension where time flowed quicker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Krovis is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Champion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d8 + 9}) slashing damage, or 14 ({@damage 1d10 + 9}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) damage.

Korvis Maxwell is a young prince from a faraway land. He has come to pay respects to the great hero Erikku Blade during his wedding day, but seems to be stuck on Ishland since the incident in Port Cattamoly happened, and the ports in Western Ishland have closed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eldak is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks) He can cast {@spell burning hands} and {@spell continual flame} at will and has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons (Solar)
entries: Eldak Gladomain's weapon attacks are magical. When Eldak Gladomain hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 6d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of Eldak Gladomain's turns, each creature within 5 feet of him takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches Eldak Gladomain or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Eldak Gladomain doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when he flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: Eldak Gladomain sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Eldak Gladomain fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Eldak Gladomain's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Eldak makes three attacks using his Fiery Talons.

action.name: Fiery Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) fire damage, plus 32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Blessing of the Phoenix
entries: Eldak regains an expended spell slot.

legendary.name: Flames of the Phoenix
entries: Eldak uses his fiery talons.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: Eldak moves half of his flying speed.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Eldak casts a spell of 6th level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.
Eldak Gladomain is a powerful Aasimar that has ascended past his mortal form, and has evolved into a Solar. He rules the Floating City of Angels with his awesome power, mostly unquestioned.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eilcaryn is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks) He can cast {@spell cure wounds} and {@spell continual flame} at will and has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons (Solar)
entries: Eilcaryn's weapon attacks are magical. When Eilcaryn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 6d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Eilcaryn doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when she flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: Eilcaryn sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Eilcaryn fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Eilcaryn's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Eilcaryn makes three attacks using her angelic longsword.

action.name: Angelic Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 34 ({@damage 6d8 + 7}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: Eilcaryn moves half of his flying speed.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Eilcaryn casts a spell of 6th level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Eilcaryn Gladomain is the queen of the Floating City of Angels. She is kind and passionate, unlike her husband who is ruling and power driven. She supposedly married Eldak Gladomain to keep him in check.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githzerai's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Psychic Defense
entries: While esk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Esk makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Temporal Strike {@recharge}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 52 ({@damage 8d12}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or move 1 round forward in time. A target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to that space if it's occupied.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lia is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks) She can cast {@spell cure wounds} and {@spell prayer of healing} at will and has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Lia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Lia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Royal Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 15 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell
entries: Lia casts a spell of 3rd level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Lia casts a spell of 6th level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

legendary.name: Healing Halo (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Lia creates a magical halo that she uses to heal nearby creatures. Creatures within 60 ft of her restores {@dice 10d10} hit points and gains 10 temporary hit points.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Lia Elvenwood is the current ruling queen of the wood elves. She has been ruling for roughly the past 1500 years and has been alive for over 2000 years. It is said that she has immortality as she is not of druidic origins, though she has made excellent relationships with the nearby druids.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Royal Knight's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Elven Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Royal Knight's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Elven Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The half-dragon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the half-dragon hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The half-dragon makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The half-dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The half-dragon adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the half-dragon must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Time Guardian's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Time Guardian fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Time Guardian's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Temporal Awareness
entries: The Time Guardian adds its Charisma modifier to its initiative.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The guardian of time can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Time Guardian makes four attacks.

action.name: Mace of Temporal Disruption
entries: {@atk mw} automatic hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and 40 force damage, and the target makes a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 24} or is {@condition incapacitated} and their movement speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Temporal Lock {@recharge 5}
entries: The Time Guardian chooses a creature within 120 ft of it. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 24} or is {@condition incapacitated} and their movement speed is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. A {@spell greater restoration} or {@spell dispel magic} spell cast at 6th level or higher can end this effect.

action.name: Temporal Travel
entries: The Guardian of Time teleports to a space within 1 mile.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Time Guardian makes one attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The Guardian of Time teleports to an unoccupied space within 300 ft.

legendary.name: True Foresight (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The next weapon attack automatically misses the Guardian of Time. Alternatively, The Guardian of Time automatically succeeds its next saving throw.

legendary.name: Inevitable Fate (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Guardian of Time chooses one creature it can see within 60 ft of it. That target makes a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 24}. On a failed save, they are reduced to 0 hit points. On a success, they take {@damage 10d10} force damage and are {@condition stunned} until the end of the Guardian of Time's next turn.

trait.name: Tandem Tactician
entries: Richie can use the help action as a bonus action.

When he uses the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, increase the range of the Help action by 10 feet. Additionally, you can help two allies targeting the same creature within range when you use the Help action this way.

trait.name: Quick Tinkerer
entries: Richie can use an artisans tool as a bonus action to repair objects retaining to that tool. For the purposes of restoring hit points to objects or constructs, they regain {@dice 3d10} hit points.

trait.name: Magitech Energy: (200/200)
entries: Richie can use his Magitech Energy in the following ways as a bonus action:
2 Points: Use the dodge action, stabilize a dying ally, or make a single weapon attack using a Magitech Weapon.
5 Points: Add {@damage 1d10} force damage to a weapon attack made with a magitech weapon or switch gear modes.
10 Points: Generate a powerful Magitech Gadget using your automatic workstation. Choose either Elemental Magnus, Healing Doughnut, or Huge Impactinator 9000.
20 Points: Release outward a powerful energy pulse centered on himself, knocking medium creatures back 5 ft and dealing {@damage 3d10} force damage.

action.name: Magitech Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 1d10 + 10}) force damage.

action.name: Magitech Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) radiant damage, plus 6 ({@damage 1d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Elemental Magnus
entries: You hurl a grenade filled with chaotic energy at space within 60 feet. Each creature takes {@damage 10d8} damage. Use the first {@dice d8}. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type. (1. Acid, 2. Cold, 3. Fire, 4. Force, 5. Lightning, 6. Poison, 7. Psychic, 8. Thunder)

action.name: Healing Doughnut
entries: You release outward a band of healing energy that disperses wildly. Each creature within 30 ft of you regains {@dice 5d8 + 7} hit points.

action.name: Huge Impactinator 9000
entries: You hurl a giant fist with rockets propelling it forward at high speeds. It rushes forward in a 200 ft long and 5 ft wide straight line. Each creature and object within range takes {@dice 3d10 + 7} points of bludgeoning damage and an additional {@damage 1d10} force damage for every 10 ft the fist traveled. The fist can also go through walls as tough as stone and creates a 5 ft by 5ft hole where it passed through, but travels at half it's normal distance for each wall it passes through.

monster.name: Huge Universal Golem Assistant

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Arm Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) radiant damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 5d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When Thyrogog reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the thyrogog can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the thyrogog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Thyrogog has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Thyrogog hits with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thyrogog makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shovel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Bertha Trimorg has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Bertha adds a +2 to her AC for this attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The alexandria guard has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Alexandria Guard makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by 15 feet (included in its speed).

trait.name: Stunning Strike (3/Day)
entries: When the monk hits with a melee weapon attack, they can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw {@dc 14} or be {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Flurry of Blows (3/Day)
entries: The monk can make two additional Unarmed Strikes as a bonus action.

trait.name: Patient Defense (2/Day)
entries: The monk takes the dodge action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The monk's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Slow Fall
entries: The monk reduces all fall damage by 40 points.

trait.name: Agile Parry
entries: Whenever the monk makes a melee weapon attack with their spear, they add a +2 to their AC.

trait.name: Crusher
entries: When the monk scores a critical hit with their unarmed strike, they have advantage on all weapon attacks until the end of its turn.
In addition, whenever they hit a creature no larger than itself with an unarmed strike, they can move that creature 5 ft.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The monk adds 2 to its AC against one melee or ranged weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the monk must see the attacker.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: If the monk is hit with a ranged weapon attack, they can reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10 + 12}. If they reduce it to zero, they can make a ranged attack using that ammunition at a range of 20/60.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The enchanter is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The enchanter has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Alice has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the alice to sleep.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm (Recharges after the Enchanter Casts an Enchantment Spell of 1st level or Higher)
entries: The enchanter tries to magically divert an attack made against it, provided that the attacker is within 30 feet of it and visible to it. The enchanter must decide to do so before the attack hits or misses.

The attacker must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature closest to it, other than the enchanter or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Noble Knight's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The royal elven knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the royal elven knight to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Elven Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by 10 feet (included in its speed).

trait.name: Stunning Strike (1/Day)
entries: When the monk hits with a melee weapon attack, they can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw {@dc 13} or be {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Flurry of Blows (2/Day)
entries: The monk can make two additional Unarmed Strikes as a bonus action.

trait.name: Patient Defense (2/Day)
entries: The monk takes the dodge action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Slow Fall
entries: The monk reduces all fall damage by 25 points.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The monk has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the petra to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: If the monk is hit with a ranged weapon attack, they can reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10 + 9}. If they reduce it to zero, they can make a ranged attack using that ammunition at a range of 20/60.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell gift of alacrity|EGW} and {@spell fortune's favor|EGW} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Kyo Osamu has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the kyo osamu to sleep.

action.name: Elven Longsword +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus ({@damage 2d12}) force damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 5d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When Thyrogog reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the thyrogog can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the thyrogog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Thyrogog has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Thyrogog hits with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thyrogog makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Shady is attuned to a Belt of Fire Giant Strength, a gray Robe of the Archmagi, and a Ring of Invisibility.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wonderous Magical Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage.

action.name: Wonderous Magical Revolver (reload after 6 shots)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Shady is a merchant who sells all kinds of magical items. Some may be cursed, some aren't, you never know what you could buy from this guy. He always seems to have just what you need though, it's almost scary.

When you purchase a magical item from Shady's shop, there is a 10% chance the item will be cursed. Roll a d10, on a 1 the item becomes cursed. The likelyhood of the item being cursed increases by an additional 10% for each rarity tier above common. In order for an item to be cursed, it must also require attunement and every cursed item dissallows a creature attuned with it from willingly ending their attunement and they have a strong desire to keep the item on their person at all times.
If the item is cursed, roll a d8 or choose one of the following curses:

rows: The first time you touch a gem or piece of jewelry while attuned to this item, the value of the gem or jewelry is reduced by half.
While attuned to this item, your movement speed is reduced by 5 ft.
While attuned to this item, you begin to feel less emotion toward most things. Your alignment becomes neutral.
While attuned to the item, you emit a sour stench noticeable from up to 10 feet away.
While attuned to this item, taking a short rest requires twice the amount of time for you.
While you are attuned to the item, your flaw is amplified in a way determined by the DM.
While you are attuned to the item, you cannot taste nor can you get intoxicated. You are also immune to being poisoned.
While you are attuned to the item, you have a permanent reduction to your AC. Your AC is reduced by 1 until your attunement ends.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth has innate psionics in the form of spellcasting. Intelligence is the aboleth's spellcasting ability (DC: 16, +8 to hit with spells) and can cast the following spells without requiring material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

trait.name: Aberrant Ground
entries: The ground in a 10-foot radius around the aboleth is moist difficult terrain and has tiny grasping tentacles. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.
A creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth for more than 10 days does not repeat its save when it takes damage.

action.name: Psychic Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The aboleth makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
entries: The aboleth makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

Before the coming of the gods, aboleths lurked in primordial oceans and underground lakes. They reached out with their minds and seized control of the burgeoning life-forms of the mortal realm, making those creatures their slaves. Their dominance made them like gods. Then the true gods appeared, smashing the aboleths' empire and freeing their slaves. Aboleths have never forgotten.

entries.name: Eternal Memories
entries: Aboleths have flawless memories. They pass on their knowledge and experience from generation to generation. Thus, the injury of their defeat by the gods remains perfectly preserved in their minds.

Aboleths' minds are treasure troves of ancient lore, recalling moments from prehistory with perfect clarity. They plot patiently and intricately across eons. Few creatures can conceive of the extent of an aboleth's plan.

entries.name: Gods in the Lake
entries: Aboleths dwell in watery environments, including ocean abysses, deep lakes, and the Elemental Plane of Water. In these domains and the lands that adjoin them, aboleths are like gods, demanding worship and obedience from their subjects. When they consume other creatures, aboleths add the knowledge and experiences of their prey to their eternal memories. Aboleths use their telepathic powers to read the minds of creatures and know their desires. An aboleth uses this knowledge to gain a creature's loyalty, promising to fulfill such wants in exchange for obedience. Within its lair, the aboleth can further use its powers to override senses, granting creatures, such as its followers, the illusion of promised rewards.

entries.name: Enemies of the Gods
entries: The aboleths' fall from power is written in stark clarity on their flawless memories, for aboleths never truly die. If an aboleth's body is destroyed, its spirit returns to the Elemental Plane of Water, where a new body coalesces for it over days or months.
Ultimately, aboleths dream of overthrowing the gods and regaining control of the world. Aboleths have had untold eons to plot and to prepare their plans for perfect execution.

entries.name: An Aboleth's Lair
entries: Aboleths lair in subterranean lakes or the rocky depths of the ocean, often surrounded by the ruins of an ancient, fallen aboleth city. An aboleth spends most of its existence underwater, surfacing occasionally to treat with visitors or deranged worshipers.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: When fighting inside its lair, an aboleth can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the aboleth takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The aboleth casts {@spell phantasmal force} (no components required) on any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. While maintaining concentration on this effect, the aboleth can't take other lair actions. If a target succeeds on the saving throw or if the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the aboleth's phantasmal force lair action for the next 24 hours, although such a creature can choose to be affected.

Pools of water within 90 feet of the aboleth surge outward in a grasping tide. Any creature on the ground within 20 feet of such a pool must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet into the water and knocked {@condition prone}. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

Water in the aboleth's lair magically becomes a conduit for the creature's rage. The aboleth can target any number of creatures it can see in such water within 90 feet of it. A target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing an aboleth's lair is warped by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Underground surfaces within 1 mile of the aboleth's lair are slimy and wet and are difficult terrain.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally fouled. Enemies of the aboleth that drink such water vomit it within minutes.

As an action, the aboleth can create an illusory image of itself within 1 mile of the lair. The copy can appear at any location the aboleth has seen before or in any location a creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth can currently see. Once created, the image lasts for as long as the aboleth maintains concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. Although the image is intangible, it looks, sounds, and can move like the aboleth. The aboleth can sense, speak, and use telepathy from the image's position as if present at that position. If the image takes any damage, it disappears.

entries: If the aboleth dies, the first two effects fade over the course of {@dice 3d10} days.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lich's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 24}, +16 to hit with spell attacks). The lich can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless the lich wishes it, he is unaffected by spells of 3rd level or lower. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation (Lich)
entries: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed dead king, julius gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the dead king, julius is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Epic Magic
entries: The lich has powerful magic that makes it harder for creatures to dispel or counter it. Any creature who attempts to dispel or counterspell his spells must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell fails and the spell slot is wasted. On a success, the spell applies as normal.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Julius has attuned to various artifacts and legendary items. He has the following items on his person when he awakens: {@item Staff of the magi|dmg}, {@item robe of the archmagi|dmg}, {@item Book of Vile Darkness|dmg}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight makes three greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
entries: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Royal Decree {@recharge 5}
entries: The dead king utters a powerful word with magical prowess. Each creature within 60 ft of him must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned}. While {@condition stunned}, the target takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage and slowly begins to lose the will to fight. The target repeats its saving throw at the end of its turn, and on three consecutive failed saves they cannot willingly make an attack or cast a spell on the dead king until the next dawn.

action.name: 11th level Epic Spell: Create Lichdom (1/day)
entries: The lich touches one creature and shares its phylactery with them. That creature becomes a lich, but can only its Rejuvination property once. After it uses this property, if it dies again it remains dead unless the Dead King Julius wishes them to return.

action.name: 10th level Epic Spell: Summon Tarrasque
entries: The lich summons The Tarrasque{@monsters The Tarrasque|OGOFW}, it follows the commands of the lich as closely as possible, but it is under no compulsion to do so at all times.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Spell
entries: The lich uses one of its at will spells.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life
entries: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet of the lich must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Energy Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature with in 30 feet of the lich must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is magically reduced by 10 ({@dice 3d6}). If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. A creature's hit point maximum can be restored with the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.
Long forgotten to time, Ichult was once a powerful prosperous land. Home to one of the strongest kingdoms, but now all that prominence was lost to time.

In a great war long ago, the entire world battled itself to claim rulership of all the kingdoms. Magic was a powerful tool in this war, but the old ways were used by the old king Julius. No one knew where or how he obtained these dark arts, but legend has it that he retreated from the war to preserve himself, and sank his castle deep underwater.

About 1500 years have passed since that war, and now that the castle has risen again, the return of the old king is soon upon us. He's been resting for over a thousand years, so he may be nowhere near his prime, but it is rumored that he was indeed immortal in age.
The Immortal Lich

"Meteors rained from the green eldritch skies, as cities would fall at his very utterings. Even the flying cities filled with powerful mages feared him. Few existed that could stand in proximity of this mighty warrior of chaos and destruction without losing their very soul to this lich's phylactery.  ."
Fear Amongst Nations

"When he was in power, it is said those who made allies in the war did so because of him. Every nation was struck with fear, and few even dared to attack during the war. He was close to winning the war, but Ishland had united, and that had finally struck fear into him. The elves, the dwarves, and even the humans. Alone they were nothing, together they were a force to be reckoned with. And reckoned with, the king did not."
Cruelty of a Tyrant

"I've never seen someone so evil to the very bone... This was no man, he was a monster. Those he didn't kill, he enslaved. He ruled a small country, might as well have been an island... Nobody even knows where he came from, but everyone knew why he wanted to rule."
The Retreat of the Mad King

"Everyone was so happy to see the rotten bastard retreat. Though, I don't blame him. The combined forces of Ishland would be too much for any country. Of course, that didn't last long. They went back to fighting after the king fled. Funny how alliances can end so quickly when the true threat is gone... I wonder if they will ever ally again, or if they'll just destroy each other."
Slayer of the Divine:

"Even the gods feared this king, they sent many clerics and paladins to their doom in efforts to fell this lich. They say he was once within reach of godhood, but was foiled by some adventurers long ago. That new queen of Eastern Ishland... she is a force to be reckoned with. Though most of the other adventurers didn't survive the fight, the queen was able to flee. Maybe it was those adventurers that gave her the opening she needed."
Bringer of Chaos:

"He turned kingdoms to ash, brought warriors to their knees, and champions cowering in fear. Some say he was going to be what brought about the rapture, the beginning of the end. He made several artifacts of war, and even managed to kill a god. He was unmatched by any known creature, and even had an Ancient Dracolich at his beckon call."
The Heroes of the Lands:

"During these times, there were five legendary heroes that attempted to slay the immortal king. Though they failed in their efforts to kill him, they managed to stop his desires to become a god, which would take many years to try and replicate the means to do so. These heroes were were Ragnarok a Wood Elf Sorcerer, Excalibur a Human Paladin, Yumiko a Tiefling Ranger, Kotone an Aasimar Bard, and Iryoku a Dwarf Barbarian. Together with the Queen of Eastern Ishland, they bravely fought against this impossible foe. Many of them gave their lives in this fight, and only the queen was known to escape. It is unknown if the others had, and the powerful weapons they wielded were lost. No one knows of their whereabouts, or if they even still exist."
Forgotten Magic

"Some say that this Lich had untold magic, even beyond what was originally thought to be capable. The epic magic used to make our floating cities pales in comparison to the dark secrets he has. No wonder the mighty heroes fell at the wake of his magic."
